We argue that UX practitioners have an ethical commitment to deploy methods that consciously shift power to create a more equitable relationship between researcher and participants. This article offers participatory video as a method for UX practitioners that democratizes the design process and creates rich visual data. We detail two cases of participatory video methods and how they were used to explore the potential of participatory methods in UX.<\/jats:p>","DOI":"10.1145\/3282665.3282667","type":"journal-article","created":{"date-parts":[[2018,10,2]],"date-time":"2018-10-02T12:09:22Z","timestamp":1538482162000},"page":"9-20","source":"Crossref","is-referenced-by-count":12,"title":"Participatory video methods in UX","prefix":"10.1145","volume":"6","author":[{"given":"Emma","family":"Rose","sequence":"first","affiliation":[{"name":"University of Washington Tacoma"}]},{"given":"Alison","family":"Cardinal","sequence":"additional","affiliation":[{"name":"University of Washington"}]}],"member":"320","reference":[{"key":"e_1_2_1_1_1","doi-asserted-by":"publisher","DOI":"10.1080\/10572252.2013.730966"},{"key":"e_1_2_1_2_1","unstructured":"Arroyo S.
